column4: i plugged my wireless card in... and then booted ubuntu.. I don't think that it is working
anyone available to give me some advice on my wireless network card?
get intel
sorry? I don't understand what you mean
intel network cards are very well supported
*sigh* i only wish someone told me that the otherday when i was asking which one i should buy
someone re-directed me to a ubuntu page listing some hardware compatibilities
then i cross check the one with good support
plug it in.. now don't know what to do with it
well as long as you don't have broadcom you're probably set too
i got a netgear
Netgear WG311 Wireless PCI Card 802.11G (54Mbps)

well if you have the proper drivers then you should be able to connect via it with a network manager (wicd is a good option) if you don't you will have to find out which ones you need and install them
how do i check if i got the drivers? and that computer can not go on the internet at the moment.. any chance i can get it installed without a internet connection (via cd)
i don't think it can connect at all, when i click on network manager it doesn't show a wireless connection
only wired
does it have an ethernet port?
if so you can use that to install the drivers (as it sounds like you don't have them) or you could download them on another pc and transfer via usb, the install cd might have them, i dunno
is there a way to issue a command to my ubuntu and ask for it to scan for new hardware?
i don't know
oh lol :(
someone else might know...I'm not that familiar with ubuntu or gnome
or dpkg for that matter
lol.. ok
